name: Shankara
description:
In the story of the pixelaurus PARK
During a mission to collect dinosaur DNA, the professor finds a cave in the forest. In the cave, the professor meets SHANKARA the forest ranger and the bearer of good fortune.
It takes the form of a 4-armed tiger and carries a yellow crystal ball. One of his hands has a circle mark that symbolizes time. SHANKARA the embodiment of human lust.
The yellow crystal ball represents the sun.
SHANKARA is protected by 3 bodyguards.
The first DRUMA bodyguard is green, the symbol of plants and animals.
AMERTA's second bodyguard is white symbolizing water.
The third guard MAHIJA brown symbolizes the land.
SHANKARA is a reminder to humans that success and luck will always cover human life, if humans always maintain a balance between the elements depicted in Shankara's figure. Between humans, sun, plants, animals, water, soil, and time
